title: Xiaomi Mi MIX 2 to allegedly sport curved AMOLED display with 93% screen-to-body ratio
text:
Xiaomi Mi MIX 2 to allegedly sport curved AMOLED display with 93%... Xiaomi Mi MIX 2 to allegedly sport curved AMOLED display with 93% screen-to-body ratio By - March 6, 2017 “Xiaomi’s Mi MIX 2 will reportedly sport a curved AMOLED display with even thinner bezels” 
Earlier this year, Xiaomi’s CEO Lei Jun revealed that the company was working on the second-gen variant of its futuristic Mi MIX bezel-less smartphone. Several reports suggested that the Mi MIX 2 would sport even slimmer bezels and a higher screen-to-body ratio than its predecessor . Now a report from China suggests that the Xiaomi Mi MIX 2 will sport a curved AMOLED display with a screen-to-body ratio of 93 percent. 
The Mi MIX sports a 6.4-inch LCD display with 91.3 percent screen-to-body ratio. The newer screen on the Mi MIX 2 will cover a larger area, which means the device get even slimmer bezels. 
The report also suggests that the Mi MIX 2 will feature the same ceramic body and bone conduction and audio technology found on its predecessor. While the earlier rumours suggested that the Mi MIX 2 will get a fingerprint sensor hidden below the display, the new report claims it will be placed below the screen. 
As per the source, the Mi MIX 2 will be launched by the end of this year. It is rumoured to be powered by Qualcomm’s latest Snapdragon 835 flagship SoC, and flaunt IP68 certification for water and dust-resistance.
